page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area explored by St.John's School of Rowlands Castle is countryside. In the middle is a valley and a railway line. {Finchdean}is the main village. The area is part of the ancient{Forest Of Bere}which was mentioned in the first{Domesday {Book.}The forest was used for hunting in Saxon times. To the east and west there are large areas of forest and the rest of the area is farmland. The forest to the east is part of {Stansted Forest}_ a large estate belonging to the National Trust. Many of the trees are Scots Pine and Larch _ trees suitable for felling. There is a sawmill on the estate. People can buy logs for their fires, and posts and rails for different types of fencing.Many people in the area own horses and lots of fencing is needed
